website_summaries.verdict: An affordably priced home swimming pool and spa water testing kit that can help you troubleshoot chemical balance issues.
pros: This handy kit can test free and total chlorine, bromine, pH, acid demand, and total alkalinity
The instruction card can serve as a quick reference if you forget any of the testing procedures
The kit also comes with a dosage chart so you know how to balance your water after taking a reading
cons: This testing kit may require a brief learning period to get the most out of it

customer_reviews.title: Why did i wait so long to get a taylor kit?
customer_reviews.text: I always kept reading on the various forums to buy a taylor kit and i always disregarded. Well i finally went ahead and tried one out and am kicking myself for not buying sooner. The Chlorine tube is more of an amber shading so it is much easier to tell where your level is out vs the variable piss color of all the other kits i have had. Instructions and case are both very good. Just overall worth the few dollars more over other kits.
customer_reviews.author: DK

customer_reviews.title: Serious about testing?
customer_reviews.text: If you are serious about testing your pool water, you need one of these sets. Strips are good for ballpark, but if you are looking for pool perfection, this is the best set. Additionally; unlike other manufacturers, you can by the components individually. I happen to use the Ph the most frequently, therefore refills are critical. If you are just a casual pool person, try this, and see how much more accurate your readings will be, and your resulting pool maintenance improvement. If you don't care, then there is no hope for you.
customer_reviews.author: ba-da-bing!

customer_reviews.title: What a great product for our hot tub
customer_reviews.text: What a great product for our hot tub. Very accurate and easy to use. I had been using test strips with inaccurate results. I bout a electronic PH meter and it showed my PH was very high but the test strips showed it was OK. When I used this kit it matched my meter. I was able to bring my alkalinity and PH down to 7.2 with the dosage chart.
customer_reviews.author: scott breece

customer_reviews.title: OUT DATED CHEMICALS
customer_reviews.text: 5 OUT OF 8 OF THE TAYLOR CHEMICALS ARE OUT DATED. R0002 05/19 , R0003 05/19, R0007 08/19 , R0008 09/19, R0015 8/19. WHEN I RECEIVED THEM. ROGER SORENSON
customer_reviews.author: Roger D. Sorenson

customer_reviews.title: Not bad for the price for spa use but for a pool I would go for the bigger unit.
customer_reviews.text: After managing hotel pools and hot tubs for many years I am used to using top of the line test kits that make it easier to test and record all water quality levels twice daily. For my home hot tub I chose this one for the price and included basics and use it weekly but use test strips for daily testing. While it does the job it is a bit harder to use and judge results than the larger pro kits. For a single hot tub it is fine along with using good test strips. For a big pool I would choose the better and larger kits. For the money it is a reasonable choice for a hot tub.
customer_reviews.author: Kuala

customer_reviews.title: Ill stick with the strips
customer_reviews.text: I wanted to love this. Its ok. It is very easy to use. Just follow the directions. My problem is with that the alkalinity is always inaccurate. I tested and it showed 160ppm. I brought the same water to the pool place and it showes as 122ppm. Ph and chlorine are closer to being accurate. I wantes to use this in place of the strips for better accuracy. So much for that.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: easy to use between visits to the pool store
customer_reviews.text: easy to use and the exact same kit (different brand but same Taylor chems) as the pool store for about 1/2 the cost with reagents that have two year out expiration dates so it is good and fresh. This kit does the basics between visits to the pool store - I test every couple of days and once a month or so take water to the pool store for the few tests that this kit cant run: hardness and cya which you don't need to test that often anyway--- a good value.
customer_reviews.author: A. Bottorff

customer_reviews.title: Reagents either expired or less than a year from purchase will expire
customer_reviews.text: Used to check pool chemistry. Reagent R-002 expires -02/20 R-002 expired on 5/19-R-003 expired 10/19 -R014 expires 3/20-R-0015 expired 09/19 - R007 expires 02/20 - R008 expires 02/20- R009 expires 03/20 3 of the Reagents are expired 5 expire in less than 1 year. This can’t be shipped back because of hazardous chemicals. But can be shipped from seller. So I’m stuck with this kit. Recommend writing seller to send you Reagents that will not expire for a year from delivery.
customer_reviews.author: Ronald

customer_reviews.title: Missing reagent #1 and duplicate reagent #2
customer_reviews.text: Been using these test kits for years, each one lasts about two years. This kit came with no Regent #1 and two Regent #2. Cannot accomplish chlorine test without all the ingredients. Had to scrounge up corner from an old container in an old kid so the test results are highly suspect. Chlorine test is probably the most important test that the kit can accomplish. No quality control. I will be looking at other brands.
customer_reviews.author: Bruce A

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy this test kit.
customer_reviews.text: Way too complicated. I'm a retired pool guy and have a tiny pool. This kit has 8 bottles with strange numbers and no understandable instructions. I should have just gone to the supply house and picked up a small bottle of Oto (yellow cap) a small bottle of Phenal Red (red cap). Those and possibly a little bottle of Neutralizer (green cap) are all you need. This is way more than any non pool professional home owner should ever have to succumbed to. Now, since it is a chemical, can't return it which actually is a good policy in our current crazy society world. DO NOT BUY!
customer_reviews.author: Morgan Chambers

customer_reviews.title: Received the kit today. Bottle 0003 leaked at sometime ...
customer_reviews.text: Received the kit today. Bottle 0003 leaked at sometime, very white and crusty. Low confidence in this kit. I have the newest model intex saltwater system, natural water hardness of average 500 tds. my water is crystal clear, no algae stains or odors. This kit required 9 drops to bring the Ph into range. Chlorine was unobservable in the test chamber. My strips show slightly low chlorine and slightly high Ph. Just don't trust it yet, will take a sample to the pool store.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff H.

customer_reviews.title: I am very pleased. It tests the 4 most important things necessary ...
customer_reviews.text: This was a second time ordering this product. I am very pleased. It tests the 4 most important things necessary for a spa tub. It is very fast, economical and highly accurate. Tests chlorine or bromide, PH, Acid demand, and water hardness.
customer_reviews.author: Fultonguy

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This is pretty easy to use. I was scared before purchasing but the instructions sheet is pretty easy to follow. I can’t comment on accuracy since I have nothing to compare it with but all the other reviews kind of point that this is best kit available in market.
customer_reviews.author: Anuj Gupta

customer_reviews.title: Gold Standard
customer_reviews.text: It's the gold standard test kit! If you have a pool using chlorine (yes, that includes Salt pools), this is the one to have. If you have a fiberglass or vinyl pool and use chlorine tablets, you're going to need the next bigger kit, because this tests acid demand, not base demand
customer_reviews.author: Dennis

customer_reviews.title: Great Customer Service.  Love this Kit.
customer_reviews.text: Taylor is my product of choice. Accurate and affordable. And customer service is fantastic. In this order, I received a defective bottle (where the seal at top had a leak), and customer service allowed me to replace it for free! (2 days). I will continue to buy from these guys and only these guys. They've won my business.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Knox

customer_reviews.title: Provides acurrate measures
customer_reviews.text: I cross reference the results of this kit with a pool store analysis and it is always on the money! Much more accurate than test strips. Beware there is a paper insert that tells you the amount of chemicals that is needed. This can easily get wet. Taylor should put this in/oc plastic laminate. I would pay an extra buck if they did
customer_reviews.author: W. Voorhees

customer_reviews.title: Spend the extra cash on the K-2006
customer_reviews.text: After owning this set for a few months and realizing what a necessity it is my only recommendation is buy the k-2006 with the fas-dpd chlorine. This unit is great, the 2006 is better and worth the extra money. I ended up buying the dpd kit separately which brought me to the same price as the 2006. Plus the 2006 test CYA which this set does not.
customer_reviews.author: BevMonster

customer_reviews.title: No dosage chart included
customer_reviews.text: It's ok. It's a test kit. However, this latest kit does not include a dosage chart with it's test instructions so you don't know what to add to get your numbers in the ideal range. Instead, it says to take your results to your local pool store for recommendations. Why did that make me laugh? Anyway, I'm adding pictures of the dosage chart supplied in my previous K-1004 test kit.
customer_reviews.author: Solaria

customer_reviews.title: Cannot determine the difference in colors making this worthless
customer_reviews.text: Cannot determine the difference in colors making this worthless I have had several people look at this kit when I was testing, and no one could tell the color changes which is *criticial* to get the count. absolute waste of money.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Cloudy water fixed within a week.
customer_reviews.text: After reading several reviews on multiple websites, I decided to try this kit. Before using this, I was using a basic cheap kit. I could not get my water to balance at all. After using this for a little over a week, my water is finally correct all the way across the readings and my pool water is clear. This is a great product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: This kit is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: This kit is easy to use. The instructions are clear and easy to follow. My pool looks much better than the pool company ever got it. I would recommend a good book,“Cruising Through Pool Care the Wise Way” by Merry Wise as an adjunct.
customer_reviews.author: Dave R

customer_reviews.title: Good kit
customer_reviews.text: Works well for a smaller residential pool. Taylor always makes good stuff. Used the larger commercial test kits at my old job which were the same as this just bigger bottles and a couple more tests but this is perfect for a regular home pool
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Corea

customer_reviews.title: Great if you want to do a lot of testing.
customer_reviews.text: I thought I wanted a more thorough kit but found that I do not like to play mad scientist when testing my pool. I feel like I am designing a cure when I test the water. It is easier to use the smaller test kit and strips. If I have an issue I just take the water to the pool store for a more accurate test.
customer_reviews.author: J. R.

customer_reviews.title: Good kit not so good packaging for shipping
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I did not give this kit a 5 was because the packaging did not protect it adequately and the item arrived with a break/hole from cracked case on the bottom of the kit box. However, this does not take away from the product itself which is actually a decent kit. The product itself has been very useful and I would buy again. However, there should be a bit more attention to packaging for shipping. Had this attention to shipping had been taken, I would rate this little kit a 5 star product.
customer_reviews.author: A.C.R.

customer_reviews.title: Good product. Good value.
customer_reviews.text: All works as advertised. This is my second one of these kits. If used regularly and instructions followed, pool maintenance will be easier, less expensive.
customer_reviews.author: bykboi

customer_reviews.title: Taylor K-1004 Pool test kit
customer_reviews.text: Use this product to test the pool chemicals. Had to replace the whole existing kit as half of the chemicals were quite expired, and was greatly cost effective to buy this whole kit rather than 5 replacement bottles.
customer_reviews.author: CD

customer_reviews.title: Great price.
customer_reviews.text: Great price. Much cheaper to buy all the chemicals in this kit rather than separately.
customer_reviews.author: Curt G.

customer_reviews.title: Quick tests but not accurate
customer_reviews.text: Convenient kit to get an idea but doesn't seem to be very accurate. Always seems to read PH as high and Chlorine as low. Kept adding acid and chlorine shock regularly but readings stays same. Pool looks nice to me with no algea so I know the levels are there.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I really like this kit
customer_reviews.text: I really like this kit. Easy! Precise and just what you need. I bought the big version of this last year but it’s overkill. This one does PH, TA and free/ total/ combined chlorine. Easy to follow instructions and adjustment charts
customer_reviews.author: julia

customer_reviews.title: Seal the bottles better during manufacturing!
customer_reviews.text: After a month or two of using this kit, two bottles have started to leak, so when trying to accurately add 5 drops from each of those two bottles, extra reagent is leaking down too, messing up the ratio of reagents. Very frustrating! Those are the bottles I use the most (for chlorine testing), so it won’t surprise me if the other bottles start leaking over time too.
customer_reviews.author: Sunshine20

customer_reviews.title: Great kit overall few things could be improved
customer_reviews.text: Great kit as I am a new pool owner. Wish it measured the cya and the colors were a bit more contrasting so were easier to read but overall good kit
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer L. Aslan

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced DPD pool water kit
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably priced DPD pool water kit that is identical to the ones I used to purchase at local pool store. Recommend keep this indoors as heat in storage box shed outside seems to significantly decrease the life/usability of the testing solutions.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Good Seller and Good Product!
customer_reviews.text: I love this seller, and Taylor products in general. This is the best test kit. And if you ever have a problem this seller works with you to make things right. Ive ordered from them several times and I am satisfied!
customer_reviews.author: Amy Matkins

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I was pool certified, until then didn't know what all the chemicals were. Now keeping pool stable is easy
customer_reviews.author: Colleen Barry

customer_reviews.title: Ok but
customer_reviews.text: I like the product but I have a few suggestions. One include a plastic eye dropper for getting the water samples level. Two, the instructions have small lettering and are printed on paper. I went and had them blown up and the paper laminated to water proof them.
customer_reviews.author: john derry

customer_reviews.title: Buy one today
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pH meter and the meter and the kit both agree. Of course the pH meter has one more decimal place for accuracy but that's electronics at work. Nice kit, organized well, and easy to use. Most important is it's accurate. I use it for my spa.
customer_reviews.author: Richard

customer_reviews.title: I don't think I will buy any more pool products online again.
customer_reviews.text: Bad product. I have been in the swimming pool business a long time and not seeing this first before buying has disappointed me.
customer_reviews.author: Neal Grenier

customer_reviews.title: Simplistic and a must have kit for any pool owner
customer_reviews.text: I bought this test kit because I suspected our weekly pool service did not have the proper levels of chlorine (low, .5 ppm) and pH was too high (8.5+). We have a 19,000 gallon pool and it took two days with two tests to get things stabilized. Very intuitive anyone can use it. After 5 days my 3rd test confirmed everything was normal with the chlorine level only dropping slightly. I'll up the automatic chlorine feeder with another 3 inch tablet making it three instead of two. This should keep us from adding the liquid for at least 10 days or more.
customer_reviews.author: Patrick Walker

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Used this same kit for decades for my in ground pool. It’s easy to use with full instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Tampa

customer_reviews.title: Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.text: I think for the price this is awesome. Comes with all the instructions on how to do the tests and also gives you pointers on how to lower or raise certain things and how to calculate it. Great product for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley mininger

customer_reviews.title: Accurate but time consuming.
customer_reviews.text: Takes a lot more time than test strips, but I use it monthly to compare to strips.
customer_reviews.author: T. Sterne

customer_reviews.title: Much better than Strips
customer_reviews.text: I like this kit much more than trying to use test strips. Very accurate and a good value.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: VERY GOOD!
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this water testing kit for years..I use it for pool water in the summer and spa water in the winter..Im always testing water!!!:):):) Its easy to use and more accurate than the test strips..a very good product!! The Taylor brand is the best Ive found!!
customer_reviews.author: L. George

customer_reviews.title: Excellent value
customer_reviews.text: Having 2 different tests for chlorine - free and total - is essential. The accuracy of this test kit is excellent for the money.
customer_reviews.author: Keith C.

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very accurate testing instrument. We compared the kit results to the computer at the pool store and they are virtually identical. We have 26 years of testing experience with our pool so we have seen the good, bad, and ugly.
customer_reviews.author: Deborah B. Chagnon

customer_reviews.title: It does the job, but more complicated that test kits I've used in the past.
customer_reviews.text: I didn't find this test kit intuitive. After doing the test, you have to open the instruction sheet to find what is needed to correct the water. My old test kit was simpler to use.
customer_reviews.author: An old sailor

customer_reviews.title: Dont know about accuracy
customer_reviews.text: Well when we test then take a water samples to Leslie's we get big differences.
customer_reviews.author: George L.

customer_reviews.title: This cost too much for what is does. even ...
customer_reviews.text: This cost too much for what is does . even the pool guy said this is the old way. test strips( 5 indicators test strips) are so much easier and quicker to use for same results
customer_reviews.author: maywefishnow

customer_reviews.title: Nice kit but tough to understand
customer_reviews.text: Seems to be a nice kit but difficult to understand how to use it. Not super user friendly, could use a small laminated instruction card to help understand in simpler terms
customer_reviews.author: Richie K

customer_reviews.title: Great Value
customer_reviews.text: Great value for the money; much less expensive than buying replacement chemicals for an existing, depleted test kit.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for bromine spa.
customer_reviews.text: Detailed instruction on water chemistry make it very easy to use. Quick delivery... Very satisfied with this dealer.
customer_reviews.author: MJDikos

customer_reviews.title: WTF
customer_reviews.text: So to do the test the instructions say to fill vial with pool water to the cholorine/bromine line. the vial say 5ml, 10ml, 25 ml. It would be nice if the spoke the same language. how am I supposed to test the water when the instruction and the kit aren't speaking the same language?
customer_reviews.author: Gordon M.

customer_reviews.title: PERFECT FOR POOL TESTING
customer_reviews.text: Best thing about this kit is it tests both levels of clorine
customer_reviews.author: Steve Ervin

customer_reviews.title: Best kit, EZest to read
customer_reviews.text: Taylor I think makes the best test kits, I really like that the colors are in the plastic not a cheap piece of paper. These kits will last a very long time, just get new chemicals. This kit is a bit more then I need but the basic kits are harder to find.
customer_reviews.author: JohnnyT88

customer_reviews.title: Outdated testers
customer_reviews.text: Product came outdated in pool testers have dates in them 1 of the 8 was outdated by 2months 5 of the others had a 2 month shelf life left I have been using this product for 3 years and like it but now I have 2nd thoughts reordered if the next kit comes like this I will have to find another test kit
customer_reviews.author: Glen M.

customer_reviews.title: Have to be scientists to use it
customer_reviews.text: Its to much for me. Get the strips. Eadier to use if u like me.
customer_reviews.author: shawn moran

customer_reviews.title: There is nothing like a clean sparkling swimming pool
customer_reviews.text: There is nothing like a clean sparkling swimming pool. This kit measures the chemical balance to insure it stays that-a-way.
customer_reviews.author: JD

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work pretty well and our water is crystal clear.
customer_reviews.author: EW

customer_reviews.title: Great kit cheaper than pool store for same brand
customer_reviews.text: Great kit easy to use and cheaper than the pool store kit
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A little complicated for me
customer_reviews.text: Gave it overall 4 stars because a bit difficult to use
customer_reviews.author: Hippiechixer

customer_reviews.title: Goodby test strips
customer_reviews.text: After dealing with test strips which I could never seem to match up with the color correctly I decided to go high tech. Boy am I glad I did. READ the directions and so simple even I could figure it out. Hold up to light and you know exactly what the results are.
customer_reviews.author: Jim B

customer_reviews.title: Reliable test kit
customer_reviews.text: I've been using this product for years. Very reliable results to keep my pool & spa in great shape.
customer_reviews.author: Phil

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use with accurate results!
customer_reviews.text: I am a Certified Pool & Spa Operater and this is my favorite kit to check the chemicals. I find this one simple enough to train others with and it gives the most accurate results.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Bilbrey

customer_reviews.title: I've ran commercial pools for years and love Taylor products
customer_reviews.text: I've ran commercial pools for years and love Taylor products. This kit was perfect for a very small home pool. All the basics needed to monitor your pool chemicals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Test Kit
customer_reviews.text: Bought this kit to replace chemicals from the same kit I already had. Cheaper to buy new kit than purchasing separate chemicals. Great price on this kit and provides accurate readings, easy to use and interpret readings.
customer_reviews.author: qtip

customer_reviews.title: This little tester is perfect for getting more accurate level readings so that proper ...
customer_reviews.text: Test strips just weren't giving me reliable readings for my hot tub. This little tester is perfect for getting more accurate level readings so that proper chemicals could be added as necessary.
customer_reviews.author: ChcgoDEB

customer_reviews.title: pool test kit
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and gives accurate results. Arrived as expected. Instructions clear and concise in booklet and an abbreviated instruction card.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Hot tub essential
customer_reviews.text: A simply hottub must have for maintaining your hottub year around.
customer_reviews.author: jan lewis

customer_reviews.title: First time pool owner, this has helped keep my ...
customer_reviews.text: First time pool owner, this has helped keep my pool clean. It has everything I need to maintain my pool.
customer_reviews.author: Justin Ainsworth

customer_reviews.title: works well for my spa
customer_reviews.text: I was using a basic two solution kit, or test strips. This tests everything I need for my spa, and works well, and seems accurate. Definitely happy with this kit. Instructions are easy to follow, and it is nice having the box to store it all in.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Complex but works fine
customer_reviews.text: This is the most complex water testing kit I have ever had. It does require a lot of drops just for one test. I find myself using my easier kits unless I am out of the drops or I am looking for a second "opinion" with the water.
customer_reviews.author: BrookeLynn

customer_reviews.title: The Best!
customer_reviews.text: Been using this for years now and have to say Taylor makes the best test kits by far.
customer_reviews.author: Big Cat Catcher

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my Hot Tub
customer_reviews.text: Forget using test strips to check the levels on your hot tub. I was always frustrated with the test strips and it took forever and lots of wasted strips to get the water just right. Since my friend told me about these kits it's been a breeze to get my water just right.
customer_reviews.author: Maxx

customer_reviews.title: Good choice for home pools and spas.
customer_reviews.text: Pretty nice set. Does a lot of tests. Nicely boxed and easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Great Test Kit
customer_reviews.text: We were using just a strip test kit for our hot tub and ended up having an allergic reaction to too much Bromine. The test strip continually called for more Bromine, when in reality there was far too much in the hot tub! My husband purchased this kit and we are now able to safely use our hot tub knowing the chemicals are adjusted correctly. We are very pleased with it.
customer_reviews.author: Michael F

customer_reviews.title: Was a bit disappointed with this purchase
customer_reviews.text: Some of the chemicals were soon to be out of date. Was a bit disappointed with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: graythair

customer_reviews.title: It gives you most of what you need to know to keep a spa in good shape. On the other hand
customer_reviews.text: If you're frustrated by using strips with color comparisons, try this kit. It gives you most of what you need to know to keep a spa in good shape. On the other hand, it requires a little time to count the drops of the various chemicals.
customer_reviews.author: Bobben

customer_reviews.title: Missing cap and important information
customer_reviews.text: Out of the box the kit was missing a cap for the testing vial. Also, the instructions said to fill the testing vial "to mark" but there were six marks on the vial with no indication which of the six should be used.
customer_reviews.author: Bob F.

customer_reviews.title: Works as described
customer_reviews.text: The best test of a pool water test kit is to have your local pool store test your pool water and record the results. Then use the pool test kit on the same sample of water. If the test results match then you have a quality test kit. This test kit does that. Two more hints for pool owner: DON'T leave the test kit out in the sun. Change the test chemicals once a year.
customer_reviews.author: Westech

customer_reviews.title: Classic test kit
customer_reviews.text: It's the test kit everyone has used forever. Easy to use, just follow the included instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Mike B.

customer_reviews.title: More accurate than test strips
customer_reviews.text: May take longer to use than test dip strips but this will be more accurate and save you money on chemicals
customer_reviews.author: WFS  D.Sc.

customer_reviews.title: NOT FOR ME...
customer_reviews.text: wont reorder....colors for chlorine and PH are both pink when testing....the least it could be is different colors..then it would be easier to see results at a quick glance.
customer_reviews.author: Glenda J. Bartels

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed.
customer_reviews.text: It seems my local pool supply store never has the refill chemical i need or in a larger size than fits into my kit at home. This kit was a little less money than the pool store and had all the chems i use during the season. And no drive to the store!
customer_reviews.author: Frank Mc Mahon

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: The only thing that may be of concern to some is the cap is a rubber cap that covers both openings. My old one had two separate caps. Some might find this more convenient.
customer_reviews.author: John D

customer_reviews.title: Very happy.
customer_reviews.text: I have 36' saltwater pool. I compared the tester I purchased with our pool service guy. It was exact results as his. Very happy.
customer_reviews.author: Rhonda H.

customer_reviews.title: Works great for backyard pool
customer_reviews.text: This is just what I needed to keep track of chemical levels in the pool. The only thing that it doesn't have is a way to test cyanuric acid levels which isn't vital.
customer_reviews.author: Sara R.

customer_reviews.title: Very pleased
customer_reviews.text: Excellent instructions, expected results and even explanations about why the various tests are important and what the side effects of high or low numbers are. Generous amount of reagents for the price, kits will last through a lot of tests. The color scales are more clear than other kits I've used, with a more dramatic color shift between different readings. The results are more obvious. Alkalinity titration swings from green to red instead of pink to clear like other kits.
customer_reviews.author: Rich Bellamy

customer_reviews.title: Great Results
customer_reviews.text: I am replacing the same kit I have been using for many years with great results.
customer_reviews.author: M. H. Smith

customer_reviews.title: Pool or spa test kit
customer_reviews.text: This kit is easy to use and has everything you need. (The only thing it doesn't test is conditioner level but I don't know of any test kits that do--my local pool supply store can test that for me.) The instructions and explanations are clearer than other kits I've used and the containers for doing the tests are perfect.
customer_reviews.author: PM

customer_reviews.title: Essential test kit
customer_reviews.text: Includes the essential tests like PH and DPD clorine for pool maintenance. Great compromise between just using test stripes and more complete but expensive kits.
customer_reviews.author: AY

customer_reviews.title: Easy to follow instructions
customer_reviews.text: Exactly the same as @ Leslie's but $13 cheaper! Has an easy to use/read chart. Everything you need to keep your pool looking great.
customer_reviews.author: FatMan

customer_reviews.title: Works excellen! I can also buy refills of the ...
customer_reviews.text: Works excellen! I can also buy refills of the small bottles of reagents from my local pool store. So if I run out of one bottle,I don't need to buy a whole new kit.
customer_reviews.author: George M

customer_reviews.title: Better than strips
customer_reviews.text: So glad I got this, using the strips to measure free chlorine was not working, this kit does it very well.
customer_reviews.author: Isabelle

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use...
customer_reviews.text: We had something similar when we lived in Vegas. Very easy to use and has the best accuracy. In Illinois, with our new pool, we had started with test strips - for the ease. Not worth it. The test strips are SO inaccurate and cause more headache. Buy this kit, you'll be glad you did.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Test Kit
customer_reviews.text: This is an oustanding test kit. You can tell that it is a high quality item, not a inferior "made-in-you-know-where" lookalike. The color standards are easy to view and the fill lines are spot on. You can also tell that the dropper bottles dispense precise drops so that your tests results are CONSISTENT and reliable every time. I had a stubborn fight with algae last month. Anyone who has ever had to go through that will tell you it's no fun. Never again will I let my water chemistry get off track !!! Skip over the kits sold in home improvement stores/mass retailers and buy the brand that the pros use.
customer_reviews.author: ATSquared

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Works well easy to read and gives you step by step to correct water issues
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to understand instructions included
customer_reviews.text: For those that use their pool frequently and want to monitor additional chemical levels beside Chlorine/Bromine & ph level, this kit is what you need. Easy to understand instructions included.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Schumaker

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product! I should've researched more since apparently I ...
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product! I should've researched more since apparently I also need to test for calcium hardness and CYA and this test does not cover them but other than that it is very useful for a residential pool and it comes with a chart to help you balance and treat your pool.
customer_reviews.author: Laura

customer_reviews.title: One bottle of reagent expires soon
customer_reviews.text: The seller sent me a test kit with one bottle of reagent set to expire in a few months, so this kit won't even last through the year.
customer_reviews.author: Leslie A. Hendrix

customer_reviews.title: Spa Test Kit
customer_reviews.text: First time Spa owner...was having problems using test strips. I owned an inground pool for many years and always used the liquid test kits. The taylor kit seems to working well and I was able to get my spa water balanced quickly.
customer_reviews.author: SER

product_meta.title: Taylor K-1004 Safety Plus Swimming Pool Chlorine Bromine pH Alkalinity Test Kit
product_meta.description: This Taylor Residential Series DPD swimming pool and spa test kit is easy to use and provides fast, accurate readings. It tests for Free and Total Chlorine (.5-5 ppm), Bromine (1-10 ppm) and pH (6.8-8.2 ppm), Acid Demand and Total Alkalinity. It features an easy-to read comparator with molded fill lines, .75 ounce reagents, and user-friendly, color-coded instructions. The flip side of the instruction card has dosage charts so you can translate test results into treatment.
feature_bullets: Keep your swimming pool, hot tub, or spa safe with this convenient testing kit
Includes tests for pH, free chlorine, total chlorine, total bromine, and total alkalinity
Testing kit tests for the following levels: total chlorine, 1-5 ppm; bromine, 1-10 ppm; and pH level, 6.8-8.2
Color-coded instructions are provided to ensure correct results
Includes .75-ounce reagents and a heavy duty carrying case
